summary: This is an email exchange between attorneys Jay Lefkowitz and Ann Marie Villafana discussing plea negotiations for Jeffrey Epstein. Villafana provides legal research on assault charges in the context of an airplane and suggests filing in Miami to reduce press coverage. The email references interactions with agents and a victim (name redacted).

events.title: Email Discussion on Epstein Plea Negotiations
events.description: Attorneys Jay Lefkowitz and Ann Marie Villafana exchange emails discussing legal strategy for Jeffrey Epstein's plea deal, including research on assault charges and plans to reduce press coverage.

keyFacts: The email discusses plea negotiations for Jeffrey Epstein, indicating ongoing legal proceedings in 2007.
Ann Marie Villafana references legal research showing that assault on an airplane falls under federal jurisdiction (49 USC 46506).
Villafana suggests filing charges in Miami to significantly reduce press coverage, indicating a strategy to avoid media attention.
The email mentions interactions between agents and a victim (name redacted) at her home, confirming factual proffers for the plea.
Jeffrey Epstein's airplane was reportedly in Miami on the day of a relevant telephone call, influencing the choice of filing location.
